exec: // we are authorised and the csrf-tokem is also valid. We need to set the x-csrf-token so the call is quicker.
// Performing a 'fetch' of the x-csrf-token makes the call longer and its unnecessary. Setting the x-csrf-token to a valid value
// will speed things up by a small fraction (which can be a lot of time if making thousands of calls!)
// we are not authorised, so our accesstoken or the csrf-token must be invalid. We shall get new ones of each!
// A 401 error might be because something is wrong with the call or even the SAP SAC SCIM API, so we need to start counting errors,
// so we don't end up in an endless loop.
if (!errors) { errors=0 };  // in case errors has not yet been set we need to set it to 0
console.log(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Fetching a new access token');
pm.execution.setNextRequest("GET accesstoken"); // once a new accesstoken is successfully returned this call will be repeated thanks to the 'recovery' variable set in the pre-request
// No user so we can't update the user. Abort this entry
// Need to set the ContinuousErrors count to 0 as we got a valid response from the API
// we are authenticated and the user does exist so we can now read the properties that make up this user
);  // the schema read must contain these definitions, otherwise we could be PUTting back missing properties
// reading the current user value of the user properties held in SAP Analytics Cloud.
// need to grab the user custom parameters next...
// .. then we can get the current value and turn it to a String to allow a comparision with the desired setting
const SACvalueisconcurrent  = customparams.isConcurrent.toString(); // we need to change this boolean value to a string so the compare works
const file_preferredlanguage = pm.iterationData.get("file_preferredlanguage");  // the desired value from the file
const file_isconcurrent = pm.iterationData.get("file_isconcurrent").toString(); // the desired value from the file.
// we need to change this boolean value to a string so the compare works
const file_dataaccesslanguage = pm.iterationData.get("file_dataaccesslanguage");// the desired value from the file
const file_dateformatting = pm.iterationData.get("file_dateformatting");        // the desired value from the file
const file_timeformatting = pm.iterationData.get("file_timeformatting");        // the desired value from the file
const file_numberformatting = pm.iterationData.get("file_numberformatting");    // the desired value from the file
// updaterequries will be true or false. It will be true if the values are different, false otherwise
pm.execution.setNextRequest(); // let Postman run the next call to UPDATE user
console.log(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': User already set correctly. Skipping user '+ pm.iterationData.get("file_userid"));
pm.execution.setNextRequest(null); // skip this row in the file and read the next row
console.error(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': SCIM schemas have changed. This script is not written for this schema version and it could corrupt your user. Aborting!');
// we got an unexpected response from the SAC API
if (!errors) { errors=0 };  // in case errors has not yet been set we need to set it to 0

const maxerrors=parseInt( (pm.environment.get("abort_after_continous_errors_reaches")!=undefined) ? parseInt(pm.environment.get("abort_after_continous_errors_reaches")) : 3 );  // maxerrors should be at least 2 to allow for recovery of invalid access token and csrf tokens
// it means a setting of 1 would mean any call following would not be allowed to re-attempt the call.
// a setting of 3 is recommended to allow at least 1 re-attempted call and any subsequent call also failing for a potentially different reason
console.error(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Too many continuous errors. Aborting. Response: '+ responseBody);
console.warn(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Continuous errors detected. Response: '+ responseBody);
// we need to read the current properties of the user,
// change the properties we want to and *then* we can PUT back all the user properties correctly having only changed the properties we need to change
const readbody            =pm.variables.get("readbody"); // reading the response body of the previous call that read the user
const username            =readbody.userName; // changes to the username isn't allowed unless using custom SAML SSO mapping on email or custom mapping

const preferredlanguage   =pm.iterationData.get("file_preferredlanguage");  // possible values: 'ar', 'bg', 'zh-CN', 'zh-TW', 'hr', 'ca', 'cs', 'cy', 'nl', 'da', 'en', 'en-GB', 'fi', 'fr', 'fr-CA', 'de', 'de-CH', 'el', 'he', 'hi', 'hu', 'id', 'it', 'ja', 'ko', 'ms', 'no', 'pl', 'pt', 'pt-PT', 'ro', 'ru', 'sh', 'sk', 'sl', 'es', 'es-MX', 'sv', 'th', 'tr', 'uk', 'vi', 'en-US-sappsd' and possibly more will be added over time!
//    this script is updating the preferredLanguage property so we are setting it here to be the value from the file in the column file_preferredlanguage
//    however, if we wanted to keep the existing preferredLanguage property value then the code would be:

//var preferredlanguage   =readbody.preferredLanguage;  // possible values: 'ar', 'bg', 'zh-CN', 'zh-TW', 'hr', 'ca', 'cs', 'cy', 'nl', 'da', 'en', 'en-GB', 'fi', 'fr', 'fr-CA', 'de', 'de-CH', 'el', 'he', 'hi', 'hu', 'id', 'it', 'ja', 'ko', 'ms', 'no', 'pl', 'pt', 'pt-PT', 'ro', 'ru', 'sh', 'sk', 'sl', 'es', 'es-MX', 'sv', 'th', 'tr', 'uk', 'vi', 'en-US-sappsd' and possibly more will be added over time!
//    you'd need to un-comment the line above to keep the existing preferredLanguage property value. Handy if you wanted to update this script to update a different property!
const meta                =readbody.meta;    // changes to the meta isn't allowed
const name                =readbody.name;    // changes to the name isn't allowed
const active              =readbody.active; // possible values: 'true' or 'false' are valid, unlike 'TRUE' or 'FALSE'
const roles               =readbody.roles;  // JSON array of SAC roles
const groups              =readbody.groups; // JSON array. Need to use /Groups endpoint until SAC SCIM API support setting groups on a per user basis.
//             This entry will be ignored until then but its set here so it will work when supported.
const dataaccesslanguage  =pm.iterationData.get("file_dataaccesslanguage"); // possible values: 'zz' (default), 'af', 'ar', 'bg',  ... many more as shown above in preferredlanguage.
//    this script is updating the dataaccesslanguage property so we are setting it here to be the value from the file in the column file_dataaccesslanguage
//    however, if we wanted to keep the existing dataaccesslanguage property value then the code would be:
//const dataaccesslanguage  =customparams.dataAccessLanguage; // possible values: 'zz' (default), 'af', 'ar', 'bg',  ... many more as shown above in preferredlanguage.
//    you'd need to un-comment the line above to keep the existing dataaccesslanguage property value. Handy if you wanted to update this script to update a different property!
const dateformatting      =pm.iterationData.get("file_dateformatting");     // possible values include: 'MMM d, yyyy', 'dd/MM/yyyy', 'MM.dd.yyyy', ... many more!
//    this script is updating the dateformatting property so we are setting it here to be the value from the file in the column file_dateformatting
//    however, if we wanted to keep the existing dateformatting property value then the code would be:
//const dateformatting      =customparams.dateFormatting;     // possible values include: 'MMM d, yyyy', 'dd/MM/yyyy', 'MM.dd.yyyy', ... many more!
//    you'd need to un-comment the line above to keep the existing dateformatting property value. Handy if you wanted to update this script to update a different property!
const timeformatting      =pm.iterationData.get("file_timeformatting");     // possible values include: 'H:mm:ss' (24H), 'h:mm:ss A' (12H)
//    this script is updating the file_timeformatting property so we are setting it here to be the value from the file in the column file_timeformatting
//    however, if we wanted to keep the existing file_timeformatting property value then the code would be:
//    you'd need to un-comment the line above to keep the existing file_timeformatting property value. Handy if you wanted to update this script to update a different property!
//    this script is updating the file_numberformatting property so we are setting it here to be the value from the file in the column file_numberformatting
//    however, if we wanted to keep the existing file_numberformatting property value then the code would be:
//    you'd need to un-comment the line above to keep the existing file_numberformatting property value. Handy if you wanted to update this script to update a different property!
const systemnotificationsemailoptin=customparams.systemNotificationsEmailOptIn; // possible values: 'true' or 'false' are valid, unlike 'TRUE' or 'FALSE'
const marketingemailoptin =customparams.marketingEmailOptIn;                    // possible values: 'true' or 'false' are valid, unlike 'TRUE' or 'FALSE'
const isconcurrent        =pm.iterationData.get("file_isconcurrent");  // possible values: 'true' or 'false' are valid, unlike 'TRUE' or 'FALSE'
//    this script is updating the isConcurrent property so we are setting it here to be the value from the file in the column file_isconcurrent
//    however, if we wanted to keep the existing isConcurrent property value then the code would be:
//const isconcurrent        =customparams.isConcurrent;                           // possible values: 'true' or 'false' are valid, unlike 'TRUE' or 'FALSE'
//    you'd need to un-comment the line above to keep the existing isConcurrent property value. Handy if you wanted to update this script to update a different property!
// if you wish to make simple modifications to this script, do so only by changing the code ***ABOVE*** this line and keep the code ***BELOW*** unchanged.
pm.variables.set("preferredlanguage",preferredlanguage);  // possible values: 'af', 'ar', 'bg',  ... many more as shown above in preferredlanguage.
pm.variables.set("name",JSON.stringify(name));     // JSON array of givenName and familyName
pm.variables.set("active",active);                 // possible values: 'true' or 'false' are valid, unlike 'TRUE' or 'FALSE'
pm.variables.set("groups",JSON.stringify(groups)); // JSON array. Need to use /Groups endpoint until SAC SCIM API support setting groups on a per user basis.
//             This entry will be ignored until then but its set here so it will work when supported.
pm.variables.set("dataaccesslanguage",dataaccesslanguage);   // possible values: 'zz' (default), 'af', 'ar', 'bg',  ... many more as shown above in preferredlanguage.
pm.variables.set("dateformatting",dateformatting);  // possible values include: 'MMM d, yyyy', 'dd/MM/yyyy', 'MM.dd.yyyy', ... many more!
pm.variables.set("systemnotificationsemailoptin",systemnotificationsemailoptin); // possible values: 'true' or 'false' are valid, unlike 'TRUE' or 'FALSE'
pm.variables.set("marketingemailoptin",marketingemailoptin); // possible values: 'true' or 'false' are valid, unlike 'TRUE' or 'FALSE'
pm.variables.set("isconcurrent",isconcurrent);       // possible values: 'true' or 'false' are valid, unlike 'TRUE' or 'FALSE'
// we are not authorised, so our accesstoken or the csrf-token must be invalid. We shall get new ones of each!
// A 401 error might be because something is wrong with the call or even the SAP SAC SCIM API, so we need to start counting errors,
// so we don't end up in an endless loop.
if (!errors) { errors=0 };  // in case errors has not yet been set we need to set it to 0
console.log(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Fetching a new access token');
// as this is non-GET call, we shall set NeedGetToBeAuthorised to true and set the 'recovery' to the GET call, so the new session is authorised, once we've obtained a new accesstoken
// We are not authorised, although we have a valid access token and a valid csrf-token!
// We need to issue a GET call to finalise our authorisation.
// It is unlikely we'll get a 403 on this call, but it is possible if the session timed-out between the previous GET and this call, unlikely but possible
// We shall need to get a new access token, new csrf-token and request a GET to finialise the authorisation required on this non-GET calll
// The 'recovery' variable is set to a GET call, when that GET call is issued, the session be fully authorised.
if (!errors) { errors=0 };  // in case errors has not yet been set we need to set it to 0
// Need to set the ContinuousErrors count to 0 as we got a valid response from the API
// we updated the user so we can now proceed to the next row in the file.
// we don't need to let Postman run to GET accesstoken
// we got an unexpected response from the SAC API
if (!errors) { errors=0 };  // in case errors has not yet been set we need to set it to 0

const maxerrors=parseInt( (pm.environment.get("abort_after_continous_errors_reaches")!=undefined) ? parseInt(pm.environment.get("abort_after_continous_errors_reaches")) : 3 );  // maxerrors should be at least 2 to allow for recovery of invalid access token and csrf tokens
// it means a setting of 1 would mean any call following would not be allowed to re-attempt the call.
// a setting of 3 is recommended to allow at least 1 re-attempted call and any subsequent call also failing for a potentially different reason
console.error(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Too many continuous errors. Aborting. Response: '+ responseBody);
console.warn(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Continuous errors detected. Response: '+ responseBody);
else  // we are on a Cloud Foundary Platform
pm.environment.set("accesstoken", jsonData.access_token);  // setting the accesstoken so its re-used for all subsequent requests
pm.environment.set("x-csrf-token", "fetch");               // we will need to request a new csrf-token as we have a new session
pm.execution.setNextRequest(pm.variables.get("recovery"));      // we will now return to the request that sent us here in the first place
console.error(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Invalid username or password: '+ responseBody);
console.error(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Unhandled error. Response Body: '+ responseBody);
console.error(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Already attempted to get a valid request. Will now quit');
console.warn(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Will make one more attempt to get a new accesstoken');

const maxerrors=parseInt( (pm.environment.get("abort_after_continous_errors_reaches")!=undefined) ? parseInt(pm.environment.get("abort_after_continous_errors_reaches")) : 3 );  // maxerrors needs to be at least 2, otherwise valid workflows may be able to correctly recover from an invalid access tokens or invalid csrf-tokens
console.error(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Too many continuous errors. Aborting');
// a valid accesstoken may have been obtained, but the request where it came from could have failed, hence the need to trap for a continous loop of errors here
